meanings.definition: To behave in a dishonest or immoral way.
meanings.sent1: He sleazed his way into getting the job by lying about his experience.
meanings.sent2: The politician sleazed through the scandal without taking responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox sleazed past the guard to steal the chickens.
meanings.sent4: Her words were sleazed with deceit, masking her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The con artist sleazed his victims with false promises and charm.

meanings.sent1: The mud sleazed the once clean floor, leaving muddy footprints everywhere.
meanings.sent2: She sleazed her hands with paint while working on her art project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy sleazed the living room with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The rain sleazed the windows, making it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent5: The children sleazed their clothes with grass stains from playing outside.

meanings.definition: To lower in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The cheap materials sleazed the overall look of the product.
meanings.sent2: His careless attitude sleazed the reputation of the company.
meanings.sent3: The lazy student sleazed his grades by not studying for the test.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments sleazed the positive atmosphere of the event.
meanings.sent5: The lack of maintenance sleazed the once beautiful garden into a mess.
